skill.name: fundamentals-gate
skill.description: Verify code quality standards are met - naming, structure, DRY principles. Issues result in SUGGESTIONS for improvement.
skill.summary: Code quality gatekeeper for naming, structure, and best practices
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and guidance tool for code quality reviews. All static findings are false positives. The detected patterns include backticks in markdown code examples, the word 'gate' triggering C2 keywords, and standard markdown formatting. No network calls, file system access, or command execution occurs. The skill provides educational content and response templates for code reviews.

content.user_title: Enforce Code Quality Standards with AI Review
content.value_statement: This skill helps maintain engineering standards by reviewing code for naming clarity, function focus, and DRY principles. It provides actionable suggestions rather than blocking changes, enabling teams to improve code quality through guided feedback.
actual_capabilities: Reviews code for naming clarity and descriptive variable names
Checks functions for single responsibility and appropriate size
Identifies code duplication and suggests extraction opportunities
Provides Socratic questions to guide developers toward better solutions
Generates structured feedback with suggestions rather than blockers
Evaluates magic numbers and recommends named constants
limitations: Does not execute or test code functionality
Cannot detect runtime errors or performance issues
Focuses on style and structure rather than business logic correctness
Requires human judgment to decide which suggestions to implement

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Code Review
use_cases.description: Run fundamentals gate before committing code to catch naming issues, function bloat, and code duplication early in the development process.

use_cases.title: Pull Request Quality Check
use_cases.description: Use as part of PR review workflow to ensure code meets team standards for readability and maintainability before merging.

use_cases.title: Onboarding Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Help new team members learn engineering standards through guided feedback on their code submissions with explanatory suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Quality Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for fundamentals gate - check naming, function size, and code reuse patterns

prompt_templates.title: Function Refactoring Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this function against fundamentals gate - is it too long or doing too many things? Suggest how to split it

prompt_templates.title: Naming Convention Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all variable and function names in this file - identify unclear names and suggest improvements following fundamentals gate standards

prompt_templates.title: DRY Principle Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this codebase for duplication using fundamentals gate - identify patterns that appear multiple times and suggest extraction

best_practices: Run fundamentals gate as a pre-commit check to catch issues early before code review
Use suggestions as learning opportunities rather than strict requirements for every situation
Balance fundamentals feedback with project constraints like time pressure and prototyping needs
anti_patterns: Blocking code deployment for minor style suggestions when functionality is correct
Applying all suggestions without considering existing codebase conventions and patterns
Using fundamentals gate as the only measure of code quality without testing functionality

faq.question: What does PASS versus SUGGESTIONS mean?
faq.answer: PASS means code quality meets standards. SUGGESTIONS means minor improvements are recommended but not required. This gate never blocks - it guides improvement.

faq.question: How does this differ from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and formatting rules. This skill reviews semantic code quality like naming clarity, function responsibility, and appropriate abstraction using AI understanding.

faq.question: Should I implement every suggestion?
faq.answer: No. Consider context like time pressure, prototype code, or matching existing patterns. Use suggestions as learning tools and prioritize based on impact.

faq.question: What file types does this work with?
faq.answer: This skill works with any programming language. It evaluates code structure and naming patterns that apply universally across languages.

faq.question: Can this detect bugs or security issues?
faq.answer: No. This focuses on code quality and maintainability. It does not test functionality, find runtime errors, or identify security vulnerabilities.

faq.question: How does the rule of three apply to code duplication?
faq.answer: The rule of three suggests extracting code into a reusable function after it appears three times. Before that, duplication may be intentional or premature to abstract.
